featured.text: Concert reviews from the period mourned the fact that the armonica sounded wonderful—only when it could be heard.
Then she returned to the U.S. in 1935 and became a top concert singer after performing at Town Hall in New York City.
The outdoor concert was canceled because of rain.
Music was moving out of the relatively small halls of Mozart’s day into the large concert halls of the 19th century, and without amplification, the glass armonica simply couldn’t be heard.
Marian Anderson (1897-1993) was an African American woman who gained fame as a concert singer in this climate of racism.

definition.en_def: A live performance of music before an audience.
definition.example: I am excited to attend the concert this weekend.
